{"title":"Page 3","subjec":{},"descri":{},"creato":{},"publis":{},"date":{},"year":{},"format":{},"reposi":{},"collec":{},"reposa":{},"rights":{},"digitb":{},"langua":{},"topics":{},"cite":{},"notes":{},"notesa":{},"source":{},"box":{},"folder":{},"identi":{},"relati":{},"findin":{},"catalo":{},"type":{},"full":"REPORT
In obedience to the instructions of a meeting
of citizens, held at the office of the Crescent Mutual Insurance Company, on the 11th of March
past, to take into consideration the propriety of
making a railroad from Algiers, opposite the city
of New Orleans, to Opelousas, I repaired to
Washington, in the parish of St. Landry, the proposed western terminus, for the purpose of
examining and reporting to a subsequent meeting:
1. On the practicability of making the road
over the proposed route.
2. The amount of stock that would be subscribed in the parishes, and whether if possible
8800,000 (as had been indicated to gentlemen
from Opelousas) could be obtained to insure the
construction of the road.
3. The advantages that would accrue to the
city and country from the road, and the value of its
stock for investment, based upon its own business
statistics.
I reached Washington on the 21st March, and
immediately commenced business operations.
The result, I now respectfully lay before you in
the order above stated.","fullrs":{},"find":"2049.jp2","dmaccess":{},"dmimage":{},"dmcreated":"2012-01-18","dmmodified":"2012-01-18","dmoclcno":{},"dmrecord":"2048","restrictionCode":"1","cdmfilesize":"554105","cdmfilesizeformatted":"0.53 MB","cdmprintpdf":"0","cdmhasocr":"1","cdmisnewspaper":"0"}
